summary: The 'America the Beautiful Act' reauthorizes the National Parks and Public Land Legacy Restoration Fund. It amends Title 54 of the United States Code, extending the fund's authorization to 2033 and increasing the annual funding amount. The bill also modifies how funds are used, prioritizing projects receiving donations and emphasizing land administered by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service.  It includes provisions regarding project prioritization, a list of projects submitted to Congress, donation solicitation, asset disposal, and a report to Congress on deferred maintenance and preventive maintenance planning.
